channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: Total Failure: When The Space Shuttle Didn't Come Home
item.description: May 17, 2017 - In Part 1 of the series Total Failure, a former NASA official recalls the disastrous mission of the space shuttle Columbia in 2003 and how the accident changed his life forever.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - In Part 1 of the series Total Failure, a former NASA official recalls the disastrous mission of the space shuttle Columbia in 2003 and how the accident changed his life forever. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/17/527052122/total-failure-when-the-space-shuttle-didnt-come-home

item.title: Advice For Your Dinner Party Stories: Keep It Familiar
item.description: May 17, 2017 - There's a difference between the stories we tell and the stories we like to hear. New social science research finds most of us like to listen to stories about familiar things.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - There's a difference between the stories we tell and the stories we like to hear. New social science research finds most of us like to listen to stories about familiar things. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/17/528730666/advice-for-your-dinner-party-stories-keep-it-familiar

item.title: Tyrannosaurus Rex's Bite Force Measured 8,000 Pounds, Scientists Say
item.description: May 17, 2017 - "That's like setting three small cars on top of the jaws of a T. rex — that's basically what was pushing down," a researcher says. Humans bite with a measly 200 pounds of force.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - "That's like setting three small cars on top of the jaws of a T. rex — that's basically what was pushing down," a researcher says. Humans bite with a measly 200 pounds of force. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/17/528677883/tyrannosaurus-rexs-bite-force-measured-8-000-pounds-scientists-say

item.title: Struggling Nuclear Industry Lobbies State Governments For Help
item.description: May 16, 2017 - The nuclear industry is struggling with aging plants and competition from cheaper natural gas. Now, touting itself as another form of "clean" energy, it's lobbying state lawmakers for help.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - The nuclear industry is struggling with aging plants and competition from cheaper natural gas. Now, touting itself as another form of "clean" energy, it's lobbying state lawmakers for help. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/16/528657268/struggling-nuclear-industry-lobbies-state-governments-for-help

item.title: An Experiment Helps Heroin Users Test Their Street Drugs For Fentanyl
item.description: May 16, 2017 - Some people on heroin die because the drug was laced with something much stronger — like fentanyl. A few needle exchange programs give users test strips to check their drug's content before injecting.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - Some people on heroin die because the drug was laced with something much stronger — like fentanyl. A few needle exchange programs give users test strips to check their drug's content before injecting. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/16/527924429/an-experiment-helps-heroin-users-test-their-street-drugs-for-fentanyl

item.title: GOP Health Bill Penalizes Patients Who Let Insurance Lapse
item.description: May 16, 2017 - In some states, a break in health coverage of more than 63 days would let insurers charge premiums of any price for a year — putting health insurance out of reach for many sick people, analysts say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - In some states, a break in health coverage of more than 63 days would let insurers charge premiums of any price for a year — putting health insurance out of reach for many sick people, analysts say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/16/528508443/gop-health-bill-penalizes-patients-who-let-insurance-lapse

item.title: The Fox And The Hedgehog: The Triumphs And Perils Of Going Big
item.description: May 15, 2017 - The parable of the fox and the hedgehog tells us that there are some who are guided by one big idea. That's the story of Don Laub, a surgeon whose single-mindedness was his triumph, and his downfall.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - The parable of the fox and the hedgehog tells us that there are some who are guided by one big idea. That's the story of Don Laub, a surgeon whose single-mindedness was his triumph, and his downfall. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/15/528041635/the-fox-and-the-hedgehog-the-triumphs-and-perils-of-going-big

item.title: Millions Of Pieces Of Plastic Are Piling Up On An Otherwise Pristine Pacific Island
item.description: May 15, 2017 - Researchers found more than 17 tons of plastic debris on an uninhabited South Pacific island. It's some 3,000 miles from the nearest big city, but ocean currents bring a steady supply of trash.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - Researchers found more than 17 tons of plastic debris on an uninhabited South Pacific island. It's some 3,000 miles from the nearest big city, but ocean currents bring a steady supply of trash. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/15/528470657/millions-of-pieces-of-plastic-are-piling-up-on-otherwise-pristine-pacific-island

item.title: How To Give Vegan 'Ice Cream' That Creamy Taste, Minus The Milk
item.description: May 15, 2017 - From avocado to almonds, vegan frozen desserts abound today. But replicating the complex choreography of water, protein, fat and sugar that milk usually takes care of is a challenge.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - From avocado to almonds, vegan frozen desserts abound today. But replicating the complex choreography of water, protein, fat and sugar that milk usually takes care of is a challenge. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/15/527656425/how-to-give-vegan-ice-cream-that-creamy-taste-minus-the-milk

item.title: Yawning May Promote Social Bonding Even Between Dogs And Humans
item.description: May 15, 2017 - Bears do it, bats do it. So do dogs and humans. They all yawn. It's a common behavior, but why is a bit of a mystery. Researchers think yawning may perk up the brain and help with social bonding.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - Bears do it, bats do it. So do dogs and humans. They all yawn. It's a common behavior, but why is a bit of a mystery. Researchers think yawning may perk up the brain and help with social bonding. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/15/527106576/yawning-may-promote-social-bonding-even-between-dogs-and-humans

item.title: Racial And Ethnic Disparities Persist In Sudden Infant Deaths
item.description: May 15, 2017 - Babies in Native American and Alaska Native families are at higher risk of sudden unexplained infant death, despite years of effort to reduce the toll. African-American families also face higher risk.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - Babies in Native American and Alaska Native families are at higher risk of sudden unexplained infant death, despite years of effort to reduce the toll. African-American families also face higher risk. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/15/528173372/racial-and-ethnic-disparities-persist-in-sudden-infant-deaths

item.title: PHOTOS: 17 Mummies Unearthed In Egypt
item.description: May 14, 2017 - Archaeologists announced the discovery of the mummies in central Egypt, believed to be from Egypt's Greco-Roman period. The country is hoping the find will boost tourism.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 14, 2017 - Archaeologists announced the discovery of the mummies in central Egypt, believed to be from Egypt's Greco-Roman period. The country is hoping the find will boost tourism. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/14/528368929/photos-17-mummies-unearthed-in-egypt

item.title: Scientists Raise Concern By Wanting To Create Synthetic Human Genomes
item.description: May 14, 2017 - In New York, hundreds of scientists discussed a highly ambitious and controversial project. They want to create synthetic genetic codes for all kinds of creatures — including the human genetic code.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 14, 2017 - In New York, hundreds of scientists discussed a highly ambitious and controversial project. They want to create synthetic genetic codes for all kinds of creatures — including the human genetic code. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/14/528335247/scientists-raise-concern-by-wanting-to-create-synthetic-human-genomes

item.title: A Mother Finds Joy In Helping A Child Navigate Their Shared Traits
item.description: May 14, 2017 - An unexpectedly rich reward of motherhood is the chance to show your child how to deal with traits passed down from you. A third-generation perfectionist and her daughter compare notes on Mr. P.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 14, 2017 - An unexpectedly rich reward of motherhood is the chance to show your child how to deal with traits passed down from you. A third-generation perfectionist and her daughter compare notes on Mr. P. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/14/528116476/a-mother-finds-joy-in-helping-a-child-navigate-their-shared-traits

item.title: The Power Of Genes, And The Line Between Biology And Destiny
item.description: May 12, 2017 - Dr. Siddhartha Mukherjee says genetics play a significant role in identity, temperament, sexual orientation and disease risk — but that environment also matters. Originally broadcast May 15, 2016.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - Dr. Siddhartha Mukherjee says genetics play a significant role in identity, temperament, sexual orientation and disease risk — but that environment also matters.
